meanings.definition: A large bag with handles for carrying clothes and other personal items.
meanings.sent1: She packed all her clothes in the holdalls for the trip.
meanings.sent2: The travelers carried their essentials in sturdy holdalls.
meanings.sent3: The holdalls looked like they were ready for a fashion show!
meanings.sent4: Her holdalls were like magic closets, fitting everything perfectly.
meanings.sent5: The colorful holdalls stood out in the sea of luggage at the airport.

meanings.definition: To have enough space for a certain amount of items.
meanings.sent1: The suitcase could holdalls her entire wardrobe.
meanings.sent2: The shelves in the closet holdalls all her shoes.
meanings.sent3: His backpack seemed to holdalls more than physically possible!
meanings.sent4: The garage holdalls all the tools needed for the job.
meanings.sent5: The basket holdalls all the fruits she bought from the market.

meanings.definition: To keep something in one's possession.
meanings.sent1: She decided to holdalls the precious necklace her grandmother gave her.
meanings.sent2: He wanted to holdalls the memories of that special day.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tried to holdalls the shiny acorn for itself.
meanings.sent4: The keychain holdalls the keys to all the secret doors.
meanings.sent5: She promised to holdalls the secret and never tell anyone.
